text: [Music]
hello i'm danvi a cloud support engineer
here at the aws office in seattle
today i'm going to show you how users
can utilize user data to run a script
every time amazon elastic compute cloud
instance is restarted so let's get
started when you're launching an ec2
instance there can be a set of commands
that you run as a part of initial setup
procedure
the user data field will allow you to
specify these commands that will run
when the instance is launched by default
user data scripts and cloud init
directives run only during the first
boot cycle when an ec2 instance is
launched
however you can configure your user data
script and cloud init directives with
the mime multipart file that allows your
script to override how frequently user
data is run in the cloud init package
for more information on mime multipart
files see the my multi-part archive on
the cloud init website before starting
this procedure kindly note that stopping
and starting the instance erases any
data on instant store volumes be sure
that you backup any data on the instant
store volume that you want to keep
open the amazon ec2 console
select the instance and then stop the
instance
kindly note that it might take some time
for the instance to go into stop state
choose actions
instance settings
and then edit user data
select modify user data as text
and then add your script in the dialog
box shown
the following example is a shell script
that writes hello world to a test file
dot text file
in a slash temp directory
the text cloud config content type
overrides how frequently user data is
run in the cloud init package by setting
the script user parameter to always
you can now go ahead and click on save
start your ec2 instance again and
confirm that your script runs correctly
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at aws
[Music]
